abstract.text: Copies the specified subdiagonals and superdiagonals of a matrix, and sets other elements to zero.

inlineContent.text: Use BNNSGraph* APIs

inlineContent.text: The number of subdiagonals that the function copies. Set to a negative value to copy the entire lower triangle.
The number of superdiagonals that the function copies. Set to a negative value to copy the entire upper triangle.
A pointer to the input descriptor.
A pointer to the output descriptor.
The filter runtime parameters.
Use

to copy a tensor’s main diagonal and zero or more upper and lower bands. You can specify that the function returns either the entire upper or lower triangle by passing a negative value to the corresponding
parameter.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Copies the specified subdiagonals and superdiagonals of a matrix, and sets other elements to zero.
A structure that contains common filter parameters.
A structure that describes the shape, stride, data type, and, optionally, the memory location of an n-dimensional array.
Rearranges elements in a tensor according to shuffle type.
Constants that specify a shuffle type.
Generates an output tensor by tiling an input tensor multiple times.
Applies a tile filter backward to generate an input gradient.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
